body_html:
@kevinshaw You can try using build.gradle to have AS automatically build and install the native libs with gradle (calling out to bazel).

If you're doing it manually the .so will probably need to go in libs/armeabi-v7a. You'll also need to copy over the Jar produced from building //tensorflow/contrib/android:android_tensorflow_inference_java, or alternatively just copy over the Java file itself.
body_text:
@kevinshaw You can try using build.gradle to have AS automatically build and install the native libs with gradle (calling out to bazel).
If you're doing it manually the .so will probably need to go in libs/armeabi-v7a. You'll also need to copy over the Jar produced from building //tensorflow/contrib/android:android_tensorflow_inference_java, or alternatively just copy over the Java file itself.
body:
@kevinshaw You can try using [build.gradle](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/examples/android/build.gradle) to have AS automatically build and install the native libs with gradle (calling out to bazel).

If you're doing it manually the .so will probably need to go in libs/armeabi-v7a. You'll also need to copy over the Jar produced from building //tensorflow/contrib/android:android_tensorflow_inference_java, or alternatively just copy over the Java file itself.
